Package nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp22.domain

Class Domain

java.lang.Object
nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp22.domain.Domain
public class Domain extends Object
The domain represents the internal state of the game. It handles all the logic between tiles, players, and actors.
Author:
Brandon Ru 300562436

    • Domain

      public Domain(Tile[][] gameState, List<Enemy> enemies)
      Raw constructor. Do not use. Use the builder please.
      Parameters:
      gameState - 2D array of tiles.
      enemies - List of enemies.

  • Method Details

    • requiredTreasureCount

      public int requiredTreasureCount()
      Returns the number of treasures on the map. Used within player to check if all treasures obtained.
      Returns:
      Number of treasures on the map.

    • treasuresLeft

      public int treasuresLeft()
      Returns the number of treasures left to collect

    • setPlayerPosition

      public void setPlayerPosition(Point pos)
      Sets the player position. Used within the domain builder.
      Parameters:
      pos - The desired position of the player.

      Move player in a given direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - Direction enum (UP, LEFT, RIGHT, DOWN)

    • moveActors

      public void moveActors()
      This function will be called when the enemies need to move. Checks if any enemies collided with enemies. Use observer pattern.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      For use in testing. Similar to SWEN221 chess toString.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel()
      This function will be called when the level is completed. Use observer pattern.

    • loseLevel

      public void loseLevel()
      This function will be called when the level is lost.

    • showToolTip

      public static void showToolTip()
      This function will be called when the player steps on the info tile.

    • getInnerState

      public Tile[][] getInnerState()
      Returns a 2D clone of the internal view of the domain.

    • getGraphicalState

      public Tile[][] getGraphicalState()
      Returns a padded 2D clone of the internal view of the domain.

    • overrideInitialTreasureCount

      public void overrideInitialTreasureCount(int treasureCount)
      Only use for persistency, no where else please. This will set the initial treasureCount
